intro: Hieracium leptopholis, commonly known as slender leaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
